shortdesc.p: Create a new Phon project.
Open an existing Phon project.
Change the default workspace folder.
The Project List pane displays the projects that are located in the current workspace folder.
Sort the Project List in the Workspace window by name, date modified, or size.

topic.title: Show Project in File System Viewer

shortdesc.p: Show a project's location using your computer's file system viewer.
Open an existing Phon project.
Expand an old .phon or .zip project for use with the current version of Phon.
Change Phon preferences.
Change tier fonts and/or user interface (UI) fonts.
Change the default Dictionary Language for use within sessions.
Change the default Syllabifier Language for use within sessions.
Create a new corpus in an existing project.
Dupliate a corpus folder in your project.
Set default participants and tiers for all sessions to be created in a corpus.
Rename a corpus in your project.
Delete a corpus in your project.
Create a new session in an existing corpus.
Open a session in the default mode.
Transcribe in multi-blind mode.
Create a copy of a session within the corpus that contains it.
Derive a new session using records from existing sessions.
Move a session to a different corpus.
Change a session name in your project.
Save a copy of a session to a location outside your project.
Remove a session from your project.
Check sessions for phone transcription errors.

In the event of display issues in Target Syllables or Actual Syllables in the Syllabification & Alignment view, it may be necessary to reset the syllabification of IPA Target and IPA Actual transcriptions.
In the event of display issues in the Alignment tier of the Syllabification & Alignment view, it may be necessary to reset the phone alignment of IPA Target and IPA Actual transcriptions.
Refresh Project Manager window to reflect changes.
Import a folder of CSV (comma-separated values) files into Phon as sessions.
Export Phon sessions as CSV (comma-separated values) files.
Add a new record to an existing session.
Copy all visible Record Data information to the clipboard.
Duplicate a record in an existing session.
Copy all visible Record Data information to the clipboard and delete current record.
Paste a record from the clipboard into the Session Editor.
Delete a record from an existing session.
Navigate between records in the Session Editor window.
View a list of records in a session.
Sort records in an existing session by start time.
Run a quick search within your session and navigate to records containing results.
Information in each session is displayed in a series of small windows within the Session Editor, called views. There are several types of views:
Maximize a view within the Session Editor window.
Minimize a view within the Session Editor window.
Move a view to a new position within the Session Editor.
Return an undocked view to the Session Editor window.
Disconnect or "undock" a view from the Session Editor, making it its own separate window.
Save currently visible Session Editor layout for future use.
Delete a user-created Session Editor layout.
Quickly change the arrangement of views within the Session Editor to the default layout or to a previously saved layout.
Edit a session's date to reflect the date of its associated media recording.
Link a media file to the corresponding session.
Add a new participant to a session.
Edit a participant for a session.
The main language for each session can be specified in the Language field in Session Information.
Create a new user-defined tier.
Remove an existing user-defined tier.
Select which tiers are visible in Record Data and change the order in which they appear.
Lock or unlock tiers against editing.
Add a new word group to a record.
Merge multiple word groups into a single word group.
Split the contents of a group.
Delete a word group.
Exclude selected records from queries.
Transcribe data from the media file.
Check to ensure proper alignment between IPA Target and IPA Actual phones.
Check to ensure proper syllabification of IPA Target and IPA Actual phones.
Validate completed blind transcriptions.
Automatically validate completed blind transcriptions.
Open a media file which has already been linked to a session.

topic.title: Go to a Specific Playback Time

shortdesc.p: Jump to a specific playback time (either user-specified, at the end of segmented media, or at the end of the last segment for a certain speaker.
Choose whether the current media position should move to align with the start of each segment as you navigate between records.
Play the current record and the following one, regardless of Speaker.
Play the media segment specified in the currently visible record.
Play adjacent utterances produced by the current speaker, starting with the current record.
Play a user-defined segment of your media file.
Export clips of your media file from the Media Player view.
Take a snapshot of linked media at the current viewpoint.
View the speech analysis view for a particular segment.

topic.title: Adjust Segment Start and End Times

shortdesc.p: Adjust segment start and end times to refine segments.
Export the current audio (.wav) segment from the Speech Analysis view.
Configuring the spectrogram.
List formant values from the Speech Analysis view.
Settings for Formant analysis.
List intensity values from the Speech Analysis view.
Configuring the intensity contour
List pitch values from the Speech Analysis view.
Configuring the pitch contour.
The TextGrid viewer in Phon displays basic TextGrid information about the TextGrid assigned to the current session.
Generate TextGrids from Phon records.
Import TextGrids as Phon records.
Open a TextGrid managed by Phon in the Praat application.
Segment media into records.
Automatically transcribe a session using an available built-in dictionary.
Find and replace text in records within a session.
About the IPA Map in Phon.
Create or modify phonetic transcriptions using the IPA Map.
Copy a character to your computer's clipboard.
Add and remove characters from Favorites in the IPA Map.
Jump to a specific section in the IPA Map.
Change the font display size and window size of the IPA Map.
Highlight recently used characters in the IPA Map.
Description of sandhi.
Listing of IPA characters.
Listing of phonetic features.
A summary of phonex constructs.
Various methods of matching phones using phonex 2.0.
Grouping in phonex 2.0.
Description of special boundary markers.
Description of phonex quantifiers.
Supplementary matchers in phonex 2.0.
Description of the phonex stress supplementary matcher.
Description of the phonex sctype supplementary matcher.
Description of the phonex diacritic supplementary matcher.
Description of the prefix supplementary matcher.
Description of the suffix supplementary matcher.
Description of the comb supplementary matcher.
Description of the tone supplementary matcher.
Run a query for patterns across sessions in a project.
Save your query script.
Open a previously saved query so that you can edit or re-run it.
Limit the results based on position or an expression defining the word group.
You may also limit the results based on an expression defining an aligned word group in another tier.
Limit the results based on position or an expression defining the word.
You may also limit the results based on an expression defining an aligned word in another tier.
Limit the results based on position or an expression defining the syllable.
Limit the results based on participant information.
View a Result Set from a query.
Save the table visible in the Results window as a CSV file.
Add, remove, edit, or reorder columns currently visible in the Results window.
Search within the results table.
View the query history for a project.
Delete a query from the Query History.
Edit a query's name, contents, and/or star setting.

topic.title: Analysis: Phonological Mean Length of Utterance (PMLU)
